intro: Chamaesyce standleyi, commonly known as the Standley's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
